intro: Mussaenda arachnocarpa, commonly known as the hairy mussaenda, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences that range in color from white to pink. The plant has hairy, ovate leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that are dispersed by animals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
